title: Srimad Bhagavatam | HG Mahaprabhu Gauranga Dasa | SB 1.7.31-32 | 07.02.2016
speaker: HG Amitasana Dasa

segments.key_quote: Simply by hearing about this Bhagavata Purana, one can develop unalloyed devotional service unto Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes the importance of hearing the Srimad Bhagavatam to develop devotion and cure material diseases.

segments.key_quote: The ultimate religious principle for all humanity is by which one can render unalloyed devotional service unto Krishna, that devotional service, should be rendered without any motivation, without any interruption.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the principle of unmotivated and uninterrupted devotional service, using the example of Pariksit Maharaj.

segments.key_quote: Then he decided to put an end to Pandava dynasty.
segments.summary: This segment narrates the events following the Mahabharata war, focusing on Ashwatthama's revenge and the release of the Brahmastra.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, only another Brahmastra can counteract this weapon.
segments.summary: This segment describes Arjuna's response to Ashwatthama's Brahmastra and introduces the concept of cosmic annihilation.

segments.key_quote: At the end of the lifespan of Brahma, one annihilation happens. That is called cosmic annihilation.
segments.summary: This segment explains the four types of annihilation described in the Bhagavatam.

segments.key_quote: Hearing about the Supreme Lord is the only right medicine for the conditioned souls to get cured from all material diseases
segments.summary: This segment details the process of cosmic annihilation, including the drought, fire, wind, and rain, and the merging of elements.

segments.key_quote: The energy produced by Brahmastra is very, very insignificant compared to the energy produced by Brahmastra.
segments.summary: This segment compares the power of the Brahmastra to modern atomic weapons and then transitions to a discussion of World War II.

segments.key_quote: Demons engage in Mugra Karma that is meant to destroy the world.
segments.summary: This segment criticizes the development of nuclear weapons and describes the punishment for leaders who harm innocent people.

segments.key_quote: King will get one-sixth share of either pious activity or impious activities.
segments.summary: This segment explains the king's responsibility to ensure religious principles are followed and how they share in the karma of their citizens.

segments.key_quote: The soul is unbreakable, insoluble, it cannot be burnt, it cannot be dried.
segments.summary: This segment discusses the effects of the Brahmastra on other planets and argues that life exists throughout the universe, citing the qualities of the soul.

segments.key_quote: Without his will or sanction, nothing can be built up or destroyed.
segments.summary: This segment emphasizes that the Lord's will is supreme and discusses the five factors necessary for completing an action, highlighting the importance of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: If one is a devotee of the Lord, if he depends on the Lord in every respect, if he depends on Lord Vishnu in every respect, for him, opulence, victory, peace of mind, all are guaranteed.
segments.summary: This segment narrates the conversation between Prithrasura and Indra, emphasizing the importance of depending on the Lord and how He sometimes removes opulence to encourage devotion.

segments.key_quote: If at all I favour anyone, especially favour to anyone, first of all, I will take away all his riches, and make him beggar.
segments.summary: This segment explains how Krishna favors devotees by taking away their riches to increase their dependence on Him, using the example of Vrithasura.

segments.key_quote: The material nature is working under my direction, producing all moving and non-moving beings.
segments.summary: This segment explains that material nature works under the Lord's supervision and introduces the story of Jayadratha.

segments.key_quote: Why you are suffering so much in this forest? Better, you marry me.
segments.summary: This segment narrates the story of Jayadratha abducting Draupadi and the Pandavas' pursuit.

segments.key_quote: He took a knife and shaved his head here and there. Shaving the head here and there, left some hair here and some portion shaved. That is as good as killing.
segments.summary: This segment describes Jayadratha's humiliation, his tapasya to please Lord Shiva, and Dronacharya's formation of the Chakraviya.

segments.key_quote: Tomorrow, by sunset, I'll kill Jayatrita. If I do not fulfill my vow, then, I'll enter fire. I'll commit suicide.
segments.summary: This segment narrates Abhimanyu's death within the Chakraviya and Arjuna's vow to kill Jayadratha by sunset.

segments.key_quote: As we surrender to Lord, Lord will also reciprocate.
segments.summary: This segment describes how Krishna uses his mystic power to protect Arjuna and ensure Jayadratha's death, emphasizing the importance of surrender to the Lord and following the instructions of the guru.
